Reviews.Title: “Horrible - don`t book this Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Armin G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When we arrrived we first had to pay the bill before we could see the room. The stairs up to the rooms were very steep and dangerous. The beds were dirty and some ( we had a room with 7 beds, 4 were broken) had used pillows & covers i have to add that they werenÂ´t comfortable at all. Even miserable was the toilet in our room, the faucet was leaky and it was so disgusting... the fire alarm was fixed with tape, so that i can conclude that people smoke there. The Breakfast was OK, we had Toast, jam, sausage, cheese, coffe, tea and juice. And we had free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs EVERYWHERE. Beds were so uncomfortable NOBODY slept.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two other friends. Upon arriving they said they upgraded us to a 6 person suite, with a kitchen and a bathroom, instead of our 3 person shared. Nice, right? No. It was disgusting. The room was FILLED with flies. The window ledge was covered, and the two beds nearest to it had dead bugs all over the pillows and blankets. The bathroom walls were coated in them, and showering meant having to attempt to spray them down with a lower water pressure shower head. ( = flies start flying everywhere, while you're naked. Terrifying). Now, the beds. Our 6 person room came with two pillows, one of which was covered in flies and covered in nasty yellow stains. The bunk beds were rickety, squeaked loudly, and DENTED in the middle. The mattresses were hard, and having a sunken in middle made sleeping nearly impossible. I thought staying here would be okay, seeing as we would be out all day anyway. I was wrong. The beds made it impossible to sleep and we woke up each morning exhausted and with back pain. Don't book here. It isn't worth it. I have never been so excited to check out of a hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “More like 'The Sphincter'”
Reviews.Author: LizzieMcManus
Reviews.Content: Shamelessly masquerading as a hotel, The Sphinx is the kind of place that used to give hostels a bad rep. Our room was small, dingy, tastelessly 'decorated' and ludicrously overpriced. The breakfast room was like a concentration camp; the mean staff huffed and puffed while they begrudgingly replenished the meager supplies of cheap bread, processed cheese and coffee that tasted like mud. To top it off, there was one dirty, old toastie maker in the whole building to be shared by all the unfortunate guests. A disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: ranoh i
Reviews.Content: I can't understand how this is called a hotel, this is a hostel by all means! I had a horrible experience staying there, smelly bathrooms that didn't lock properly and tiny rooms with very steep stairs that made it very difficult to carry my hand bag even! the is no phone in z room for reception so I had to go all the way down from the 4th floor whenever i want anything:( and to top it off i found a hair on my pillow and the sheets were not changed in one of the beds! in summary avoid it while u can..

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for the quality you get”
Reviews.Author: Sandypas
Reviews.Content: The overall impression is: shabby. Toilet was smelly. Rooms are carpeted and this gives you the usual dusty and smelly carpets, if they are not properly maintained. Breakfast: essential, not much variety if you stay more than 1-2 nights. Firstly, I would like to say that I am not a person with a delicate stomach. Unfortunately, my friend and I ended up searching for a hotel at the very last minute and this one suited our budget. I didn't know what to expect from a 1 star hotel, however, in spending 97.50euros per night I'd expect something better. It is too much for the quality you get. The cost is only justified by the location, I believe. The photos on their website could date back to when the hotel was NEW, or perhaps they took photos from another hotel??. We stayed in room 17 (twin room with shared bathroom). There was hardly any space to move between the beds and in the room in general. There were clean towels and soap (squeeze bottle, which is hygenic enough). This was the only good point about the room. The hand wash basin seemed clean, but the glass shelf attached to the mirror had not been wiped. The duvets seemed clean. We didn't feel itchy or suspected there were any bugs, as you often read in other reviews. I found a hair after I first sat on the bed, but that could have been one of mine. The cupboard was about 50cm wide and there was just one hanger. The carpet was dusty and smelly. The smell was not pleasant but after a while in the room we got used to it! There was a small brand new LCD screen that really clashed with the rest of the room. It was only possible to listen to the music played by the hotel staff (I assumed). No remote control in sight, couldn't figure out if it was meant to be a TV. The toilet was right next to us and was always smelly. They put a deodorant spray bottle, that we used all the times when going in. Initially I thought that perhaps the staff only cleaned once a day and the rest of the day the toilet could be left dirty by the customers. However, after 2-3 days, the smell was always the same, which told me there was something chronic about that toilet. I wiped an antibacterial tissue on the toilet seat every time before using it. The shower was also average. Hair left by previous users didn't make it showering in there a nice experience. The staff was always friendly. There are 3 computers that can be used for free 24 hours. That's another good point. They also have 2 types of good free city maps, and all sorts of brochures. The breakfast room is not the usual breakfast room you may expect in a hotel. It does not look like the one in the photos (I didn't see any romantic fireplace, plants, etc). It consists of a few tables (no cloth) and chairs on either side of the reception desk. They give you the usual butter, jam, bread slices, cheese slices and ham, tea and coffee, pineapple and orange juice (which tasted as if water had been added into them), serviettes. That's it. There is a toaster and a sandwich maker. If you try to take food away (as in a takeaway sandwich) there is a fine of 20euros. Initially, we looked for a place that was in between the city centre oval and the museum area, so this seemed a good area. The location is good because it is close to the Heineken Brewery, Leidseplein, Albert Cuypstraat market and a short walk to the Munttoren (Minttower, Flower Market). However, as we learned after booking, with a transport card (7.50 for 24 hours, 11.00 for 48 hours, etc) you could really book anywhere around the city, finding affordable renovated (=clean??) hotels in a nice residential area such as around Vondelpark and Museuumplein, thus avoiding both the 5% city tax that you pay if you stay within the canal circles and possibly shabby places like the Sphinx Hotel. Finally, I can confirm that NO, we did not see any mice in our room, even if I was thrilled at the idea! However, in the morning of the 3rd day, a couple of Spanish girls complained that they had found food packages chewed and they suspected there were mice. The only thing the girl at the reception commented was: YOU SHOULDN'T LEAVE FOOD IN YOUR ROOMS! That's right! How about: We shall DISINFEST ASAP? I believe we did not see any mice because we were on the 4th (last) floor and they might not get that high up. On the other hand, the stairs were unbelievably steep and 4 floors were a killer to climb twice a day. However, this seems to be a common feauture of Amsterdam old buildings, so no point in complaining. But if you really wish to stay at this hotel, remember: lower floors = risk of mice; higher floors = steep climibing. We only had hand luggage, luckily. And remember to bring downstairs your own rubbish upon checking out, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL FROM HELL-HOTEL SPHINX AMSTERDAM”
Reviews.Author: neil s
Reviews.Content: I stayed there back in 1997 and it was a nice hotel, sadly my image of the hotel was from that time and I made the big mistake of not reading other peoples reviews of the hotel. the hotel should be renamed HOTEL STINX. its nothing more than a 1 star hostel and 1 star is being generous. rooms are small and shabby- shower door came off when my wife was using it, drawers broken on bedside cabinet. single wardrobe in a double room. room had not ben cleaned and we had toask for clean towels as they had not been changed, breakfast was DIY toasties, sorry looking cheese and ham in plastic boxes and tea/coffee in flasks. we were charged 500 euros for 5 nights, in hindsight we should have left and gone elsewhere but we would have lost some monies in cancellation charges, but some money would have been better than staying the full term. we also had to pay 5 euros for a pass key. safe was broken in room so we had to lock valuables in case. Please please please do not stay in hotel sphinx

Reviews.Title: “A place with a bed.”
Reviews.Author: savagedan
Reviews.Content: Conditions of the rooms were slightly more warn then pictures may have shown. It's a little far from the action packed night life of Amsterdam, however bikes made that an easy fix. On a positive, they did what they could to fit us in on a weekend with no reservations. It wasn't the worst place we could have ended up, but it certainly wasn't the best for the euro spent.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1174
Reviews.Content: WORST HOSTEL I'VE EVER STAYED IN. Unfriendly staff, dirty bathrooms, breakfast = slice of bread with ham and cheese. But worst: only one key per room, so you have to wake up others to get in, or run up and down four sets of stairs to check if you can get in or not (and once you are allowed to 'borrow' a key from staff, you need to find a way to keep the door open because you have to return it to them). ABSURD AND EXPENSIVE.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in 2009”
Reviews.Author: GillHuk
Reviews.Content: went in 2009 and from what iv read, its not changed at all! To call this a hotel is an insult to hotels. We arrived at 9am after traveling since 2am, couldn't get in our room until 3pm, the couldn't accommodate us to wait in there but allowed us to leave our bags (which were chucked on a pile with others) and offered us a cup of tea, after the tea we were promptly ushered out the door! When we finally got our room, it was clean and tidy but very very small, we had a shower but toilet was out in the hall! We were on the top floor and getting up the stairs with bags was very difficult, not assistance was offered. Stairs get steeper and narrower as you went up, you stood on one step and 5 steps up was in front of your chin! Maid staff, well, i awoke one morning to what looked like a 15 year old child stood in a track suite holding towels, no knock and wait for a reply, she was just there! Reception was just a whole in the wall, and not very helpful, had to fight for them to ring us a taxi to the airport! Dont get a taxi unless you have too, he drove us all round Amsterdam and conned us, couldn't speak any English when we asked where he was going. We went such a long time ago and enjoyed the holiday, surrounding area was lovely, quiet and a short distance away from pubs bars etc, i'd recommend the restaurant that looks like a carousel, we ate breakfast there every day (didnt once eat int he hotel, and tried to avoid staff at all cost) staff consisted of 2 blokes and 1 chamber maid that we seen. Please please please pay a little bit extra and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING*******DONT RUIN YOUR HOLIDAY BEFORE IT EVEN BEGINS”
Reviews.Author: mrkevin30
Reviews.Content: This Hotel Is The Most Disgusting Hotel I Have Ever Stayed In,,My Partner And I Booked In To This Dump For 3 Days,,After 3 Minutes I Wanted To Go Home. The Hotel Itself Is Minging And Dirty The Rooms Are Tiny(room 8) No Ensuite Bathroom Even Though Advised It Was,,The Pictures On The Web Page Must Be From A Different Hotel Cause Certainly Wasnt This One, I Booked A Double Room And Got A Cupboard With A Set Of Bunkbeds In It,,The Shared Bathroom Facilities Were A Disgrace And There Was Absolutly No Way I Was Going Down For Any Breakfast,,There Was Electrical Wires Coming Out The Wall Where We Slept,, I Could Rattle On For Hours To Be Honest But I Spent Enough Time Thinkin About This Place,,,,U HAVE BEEN WARNED Your Choice

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: Aristos9
Reviews.Content: It is much more better to sleep outside on the road! The room was very very very dirty, the room size was is 2 x 3 sq.m for 3 people. You may hear how people next door are talking. It is very noisy in the hotel - there is no sound isolation. The breakfast was just bad. My advise - do not go there. This is a no star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: Quincy21
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in my fair share of hostels and I know what to expect when staying in them but this has got to be the worst I have ever seen. The bathrooms were disgusting, and smelt of urine. There was only one key per room, and when you're sharing with strangers this can become a problem! The staff were also very rude and very unhelpful. We were charged more than what we should of been and when we questioned this the staff pretended not to understand us. The "cleaners" also threw away some of my friend's belongings, there was no apology or explanation made. The breakfast is also not worth getting up early for. Honestly the worst place I have ever stayed. There are far better and cheaper hotels in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: chadd3
Reviews.Content: Although a little out the way from the actual sights and sounds of the centre of Amsterdam we found the Sphinx located within 5 minutes walk of the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum which was great. Also not too far from Rembrandtplein and the Redlight District (about 30 minutes walking tops). Our dorm was as you would expect for 80 euro for three nights - not luxury at all....but then you're not paying for luxury in the first place. What you get is a bed with clean sheets, a functioning bathroom, a light breakfast and the chance to meet other travellers from across the world. Anyone expecting more than that from a hostel at this price range is daft! This hostel is utterly perfect for those who just want a good place to sleep after a nice night out in the city and would rather get out and see the sights and sounds than rather sit and mope in a luxury hotel room and not absorb the culture.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: JackSG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is abysmal. It is shabby, the bedrooms are a complete disgrace and the so-called breakfast inedible. If I were director of environmental health for Amsterdam City Council I would close this dump immediately.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayedin!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GnSDenmark
Reviews.Content: Just the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Rooms are tatty, no bathroom in most rooms, owners try to charge you for everything, you have to wash your own breakfast plates, sheets and towels were old and grubby. Guests are noisy at all times of the night. What more can I say other than just don't stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “MOST TERRIBLE STAY EVER.”
Reviews.Author: onionize
Reviews.Content: ridiculously SMALL room (3 bed 6 sqm. room) TOILETS and SHOWERS SHARED with entire floor YOU CANT SIT ON THE TOILET (there is no space in the room) our WINDOW didnÂ´t have a handle so it was OPEN ALL the TIME (we told them, but within a week nothing happened) one was a BUNKBED - PRISON alike, the other was an old sofa with a matrace laid on they will CHARGE you for EVERYTHING. (baggage storage fee (for keeping the baggage for 3 hours 5â‚¬ per bag), breakfast - takeaway fee (if you take something from the buffet 20â‚¬), SMOKING is NOT ALLOWED (NOT EVEN on the BALCONY - 200â‚¬ fee for that :) ), ... there were CABLES hanging from the WALLS. there was ONE TINY CLOSET (for 3 people impossible to store clothes and baggages in) ROOM-SAFE DIDN`T WORK only ONE TOWEL for 3 PEOPLE NO ELEVATOR - small STEEP STAIRS and 4 floors (DEFINITELY UNPLEASANT) - almost too little to carry your bag on OUR ROOM WAS NOT CLEANED FOR 7 DAYS one PRO: good location price performance ratio: FAIL even for CHEAP NEARLY GOT A PNEUMONIA FROM THE OPEN WINDOW (WHICH COULD NOT BE CLOSED)

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, smelly room with no toilet...”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo2005
Reviews.Content: Filthy, smelly room with no toilet. Offered room with toilet for an extra eur60 which turned out to be even worse so declined and went somewhere else. They refused a refund.

Reviews.Title: “A BUNCH OF LIARS”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam62
Reviews.Content: Never ever choose this hotel! Their only aim is to rip you off! I had to cancel my reservation with them. The conditions I received after booking said you can cancel up to 48 hours before arriving without any penalty. I did so. Then they started claiming that the limit is 72 hours and charged me for the first night. When you check their website they say 48 hours themselves. They were simply lying and I could not do anything about it!

Reviews.Title: “Wrost hostel I have EVER stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: hels123
Reviews.Content: 25 of us stayed in this hostel for a hen night for a long weekend. The staff were really rude and the security guy followed one of the girls up to her room and wouldnt leave. There were bed bugs in room 10 so some of us had to leave which caused a massive pallava with the lady on reception...she accused us of lying and said it was our fault and we had bought the bed bugs with us from home. She also laughed in our faces when we showed her the bites. I would never recommend this place to anyone, there are much nicer hostels in Amsterdam where the staff are nice and you feel safe. Also the place was falling apart (including the hand rail on the steepest stairs ever had fallen off) - really unsafe! Stay here at your own peril!

Reviews.Title: “flea pit, the woman who run's it is a monster”
Reviews.Author: AngleseaFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: This place is a flea pit. The woman who runs it is a horror. I stayed for one of the three nights I booked. In the morning, as I was eating breakfast, a group of girls complained to the woman. They were covered in bedbug bites and wanted a refund so they could book another hostel. The woman screamed at them, accused them of bringing the bedbugs with them (from their homes in England) and didn't refund the money until after a 15 minute argument. In fact, she forced the girls to apologize to her for being upset before she would give them back a cent. I was so shocked by this I left immediately and booked a hotel for the remaining two nights. The place is infested and the woman who operates it is one of the most despicable human beings I've ever met.

Reviews.Title: “Awefull Hygience Avoid like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: Jigzyy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel with friends, i am under no illusion you get what you pay for,however just because its a 2 star doesnt give it the right to charge 45 euro a night and be dirty and damn right discusting,the room itself was full of mites and bed bugs,i booked for 3 nights and needless to say i only stayed for 1night after being eaten alive by bed bugs and looking like the elephant man. The staff and manager are unbeleivable rude and have no care for customer service,only in taking your money,no refund was given for the other 2 nights,avoid like the plague as you'll end up catching the plague if you stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Horrid, Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: eak_10
Reviews.Content: We reserved a 2 night stay in this hotel. On arrival the lobby looked a bit seedy but we checked in. Our room was up two floors on stairs so steep and narrow I could not get the luggage up without the help of my husband. The room was tiny with a single bed and a bunk bed with a sink. The shower and toilet were in the hallway. The place was full of young men in varying states of undress. Everything was fifthy, the carpet, bathrooms. Having recently attended a seminar on the bed bug problem in public housing in NYC I immediately recognized the signs of bed bugs. The sheets looked washed but you could see little blood smears, a sure sign of bed bugs. Bed bugs come out only at night and will infest all your belongings. We went downstairs, said we were leaving and demanded a refund. They refused and, obliviously knowing about the problem, offered to have the place sprayed. We left and have disputed the charge. We ended up traveling south to Utrecht and stayed in a very nice hotel, the NH hotel. We took the train into Amsterdam the next day and had a great tour with New Europe a free tour of the city.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: markholt8
Reviews.Content: Hi, Long time viewer first time reviewer here, a group of 8 of us stayed at the Sphinx Hotel for Queens Day weekend in 2010. Too often you look at sites like this to learn about where to stay but I tell you something if I believed everything on here I'd never go away! Everyone has different standards, different company and different reasons to go away but also, there's also a lot of 'Britishtouristitis', you know the type, complaining about passport control queues, moaning about the 'foreign food' and such like. So here is an objective, real world review of the Sphinx. If you're going to experience Amsterdam in all its boozy, hazy, seedy glory with a bunch of mates, its fine. Its a bed for the night in a decent part of town, really easy access to the centre (there were no trams on queens day but I didnt mind the walk.....and I'm very very lazy). The staff are nice and pleasent enough, the breakfast is unspectacular but its better than nothing and for the price you pay you shouldnt really get anything. Don't go to this hotel if you're on a romantic break or are of the more *cough* mature generation, the place isnt dirty but is in slight need of touching up, the stairs must only be used by people with mountaineering certificates and the bathrooms are slightly...slightly better than the streetside urinals you see throughout the streets. At the end of the day you're paying hostel prices for a hotel, ok you wouldnt see the president of the golf club in there but hey, more money for pleasurable activities (whatever they may be..). If all you want is a place to crash after enjoying the 'dam (thats right I've cleverly given it a name) then by all means go ahead and book, but if you're used to your mints on the pillow then don't.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: mtaiwai
Reviews.Content: For EUR45 per nite per person in a 3-bed room, this is definitely daylight robbery. Some more, the railing for the steep stairs on 2nd floor has come out of the wall. Safety issue..The window in the room cannot be shut properly. Maintenance issue. The breakfast is minimalist. The internet PC near the reception looked like it's been down since day 1. Honesty issue. The location is near to a few POI, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Probably my worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: bgls3000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel several years ago but the experience was so bad, it deserved to be reviewed and people deserve to be warned. We were allocated a room which, without a doubt, was the former utility room, right beside the reception area on the first floor. It was about 2 meters wide, with 2 single beds, and a gap of about 20cm between the two - the only space in which to walk or stand. The grubby blue carpet had a large black stain on it. The bathroom was a shared one, but was exceptionally unsanitory. Some other guests locked themselves out, so they spent the entire night ringing the buzzer to be let in. However, the receptionist had secretly snuck out for the night, so he was not there to let the guests in! In the end, I had to get up, get dressed, and let these people in myself. Yes, this is the hotel where you have to pay to do the job of the staff ! Breakfast was disgusting, and we eventually demanded our money back, and checked into another hotel on the Rembrandtplein. Please be warned, this is a terrible hotel and should not be allowed to continue running. Even years later, the experience is unfortunately still with me. And furthermore, I don't believe a word of the reviewers who have all given it a 5-star rating (in various languages but almost the same wording) . It's clearly the work of an insider trying to make the place sound good.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures tell a different story...”
Reviews.Author: lf_cnc
Reviews.Content: Before I write the review, yes I am aware that this is a two star hotel and you get what you pay for but... The pictures that this hotel use to advertise itself, I think, must be from another hotel as they were certainly not taken in the room I was in (8). The room was 8ft x 4ft with a bunk bed that was squeaky and had no side to the top so little dodgy; no bathroom; a sink that had hairs etc and a towel that must be older than me. I had to wait in reception (in the loosest term) for someone to book me in for 10 minutes as nobody was around - just what you need after a day at work. It is also in a bad part of town and walking around with a suit / laptop or as a female alone would best be avoided. Also worth mentioning that the rooms on the road have a nice wake up call all night of the trams going past - not only can you hear them but you can actually feel them vibrate as well. Would I stay there again - NO NO NO. Hope my review helps you make a more informed decision.

Reviews.Title: “:]”
Reviews.Author: devainton
Reviews.Content: After reading past reviews for the sphinx hotel i was dreading going there but once shown to our room i couldnt have been any more amazed and relieved! Despite being named a hotel it is a hostel, so its nothing fancy. Travelling with a group of 7 people, it was hard to find a 7 dorm room but thankfully we found one here as we didnt want to share with anyone else. We had our own ensuit which was great, however we found that the room sometimes smelt damp, but it didnt bother us. I definately wouldnt suggest couples to go to this hotel/hostel or party animals considering my group was told to be quiet 2 times eventhough we werent that loud but it was a nice place and its right next too a nice quiet canal with grass to sit on in the evenings to chill.

Reviews.Title: “Under no circumstances”
Reviews.Author: holden-cz
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. The place itself is terrible, the carpet in the rooms looks like someone recently died. They billed my credit card twice, once before we had even arrived and not for just one night, for all 3 nights which is not the agreement I made booking it. Then I had to fight to get that taken off, next they charge you 4% for using a credit card. Which is against the Visa/Mastercard vendor agreement (hint: you can get this taken off by calling your card). They charge another 5% for some other imaginary fee. The breakfast is white bread and cheese. Possibly the dead person left it before being brutally beaten onto the carpet of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay in the Hotel Sphinx”
Reviews.Author: hatuki
Reviews.Content: Have reserved hotel from May, 29 till May, 2nd, to us have sent listing and acknowledgement on Ð±Ñ€Ð¾Ð½ÑŒ, all 3 nights at the price of 250 euros (30 euros have removed at once from a card, and the others on arrival). When we have arrived us the FIRST unpleasant moment waited: from us took for these nights not 250 euros, and 362 euros + those 30 euros which have removed at once at booking, referring to taxes and tax collections, excuse certainly, but really taxes can make 100 euros and why about it anywhere do not specify? If we knew it, have never agreed. The SECOND unpleasant moment: Have lodged us on the ground floor in a room number 4 when we have opened a door I was horrified (stinks awfully, whether dampness, whether from a carpet, well it is very strong, walls dirty, mattresses dirty, at one bed the broken fixture, a carpet dirty, even it was terrible to me to come on it, all in not clear stains, a case small, hangers broken when there has come night and we tired have come back to this smelly number, thought we will sleep, but alas it there was a THIRD surprise: near to a room there was a toilet, doors in hotel were not closed and into a toilet came not only those who lived in hotels, but also any passers-by, certainly told all loudly, and to the personnel was visible to spit that in this room there live visitors from other city and which have paid for this number not small money. Here so respected, never stop in this hotel, for such sum it is possible to find much more the best hotel and is more subcentral. Listen to councils, the description the naked truth.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Clear”
Reviews.Author: rikstar28
Reviews.Content: We were there for the football and we booked last May through easytobook.com. When we arrived we were told that they did not have rooms for us and they had e.mailed the relevant people last September to notify them of the cancellation, we did not receive that e.mail. There was more than one party who they did not have rooms for. We stood and angued our case for over three hours and eventually the manager gave us two rooms, which in turn means someone else would be without a bed for the night. Basically we read reviews telling us that they double book all the time and it is a terrible place to stay but we did not think it could be that bad, please beleive me when I say - STAY CLEAR AND DO NOT STAY AT THE SPHINX HOTEL IN AMSTERDAM.

Reviews.Title: “Ther's many other better options”
Reviews.Author: Khytus
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean enough, the staff were correct but nothing else. They didn't help us in any thing with the city o even with the payament. We were on the fifth floor with no lifter and incredible stairs. We booked a suite room expecting al WC and a shower in ther room(as the web site sais) but de WC was on the corridor to be shared with all the others rooms. The hotel is far away from tne city centre if you wanna go by walk. I wouldn't return to this hotel, is better pay a little more and be confortable.

Reviews.Title: “It is not expensive to be clean and polite.”
Reviews.Author: BinnyB
Reviews.Content: It is not expensive to be clean and polite: So why is the Sphinx hotel so dirty? Mold in the bathroom shower, stains on the carpet, dust everywhere; our room smelled awful. So why was the hotel staff rude and unprofessional? Yes, the Sphinx is a cheap hotel in the center of Amsterdam but fails to meet minimum expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Utter hellhole!”
Reviews.Author: dou9
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the Sphinx, our party of 5 were told that all three of our rooms had allegedly flooded and we had to pay extra for a large single room if we wanted to stay. The staff were exceptionally rude and argued that it was not their problem and we could go elsewhere if we did not wish to pay more. Due to the time of arrival, we decided to take the single room which turned out to be the worst room I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. The place stank and the decor looked decidedly war zone with holes in the walls, a multitude of dodgy stains and a carpet that you daren't walk on with bare feet. To make matters worse, the bunk beds (yes bunk beds) were all bent in the middle so made for an interesting sleeping position; thats when you could actually find a period of silence long enough to get some kip! All I will say about the breakfast is that after a brief look, I abstained and ate at one of the excellent local bakers. I realise that this is a budget hotel but it fails on even the basics....book at your peril!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: AugustInParis
Reviews.Content: I was initially nervous to stay in such a cheap hotel, but as a student there was not a lot of choice, but I was pleasantly surprised by the Sphinx. I stayed with my friend and booked a twin shower room, we got a big six bed room with toilet and shower as well as a small step out balcony that was s nice surprise! The rooms are clean enough and towels are changed daily. It is noisy however, and if you're a light sleeper definitely bring earplugs! The only other niggle is that the power sockets in the room were about 6ft up the wall behind the tv, so me and my 5ft mate had to stand on chairs to use hairdryers and such. The staff were fine, let you get on with it and help if they can, so all in all not bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: weenireeni
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the cheapest I could find in Amsterdam. Was nice enough room - clean and tidy. Good transport links, near to heineken museum and bars such as Hard Rock Cafe. Just be warned the stairs to the rooms ar every steep, and no lifts. Would stay again for a cheap few days

Reviews.Title: “no frills stay”
Reviews.Author: quiny
Reviews.Content: recently stayed at this hotel with my wife and our friends,i booked this hotel as we wanted to stay in amsterdam central but not spend vast amounts on rooms and hotels we knew nothing about.the hotel was a budget 3 day trip costing around Â£150 per couple for three nights the hotel is very basic with my friends and myself staying in so called deluxe double rooms. dont take the cat you cant swing it in short .the hotel is very basic but if you book budget thats what you get .hot water and clean towels everyday and nothing trying to eat us while we slept so very basic but ok.good location quiet with good tram routes in dam square and central station

Reviews.Title: “absolute kip...”
Reviews.Author: ireland2000007
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay at this place...it is a death trap..the rooms are tiny, room is very dirty, bin was not changed and blood stain in my bed linen. staff were very very insulting and unhelpful...when asked to change bed linen and dirty towel, we were told if we do not like it find another holet which we did....breakfast consisted of bread and cheese and juice..nothing else

Reviews.Title: “not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: lukenukum
Reviews.Content: cons: - had to pay BEFORE staying - "NO REFUNDS" sign up - the bedroom was tiny and dingy - the bed was broken - the towel was ripped! - the fire alarm was hanging out of the ceiling - walls paper-thin, ear-plugs a MUST - the breakfast was a awful. bread, cheese and salami not even a toaster. pros: - the shower was good - the location was 'ok' really didn't enjoy staying here. didn't see any of the other rooms so can't comment on them but basement floor 'delux suite' was really bad. couldn't recommend to anyone anything about this hotel, do not stay here if you can help it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: shoegal24
Reviews.Content: Double room in the basement was tiny - literally about 30cm space between the bed and the walls. Dark, dingy and not very clean. Location was not too bad, but expect about 25 minute walk into the centre of Amsterdam (Dam Sqaure, Red Light District etc.) Good tram-links though. Basic, cheap and value for money, I suppose!

Reviews.Title: “Budjet holiday will go back again”
Reviews.Author: GizmoCheshire
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at The Sphinx. We have stayed here a couple of times and hope to book to go back again soon. The rooms are basic but cheap - the bedding and the towels were changed every day. We had 2 triple rooms and they both had 4 beds in so we all had enough space. The location is fab - on tram 16/24 its the 5th stop from the train station or 3 stops away from Dam Square and the tram stops just a 1 min walk away. 6 of us went and only 2 of us tried the breakfast - they only tried it once as not very nice, but there is a nice little bar on the corner where you can get the most wonderful pancakes. The stairs are a little steap and us girls found it easier to work down them with no shoes on - but it all added to the fun ! At the end of the day the hotel is cheap,clean and in a good location = oo try the Bottles and Bites bar around the corner and have some chips with peanut butter sauce!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sphinx disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: marieeliz5
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 2 night stay at the sphinx hotel and have mixed reviews for it. On arrival i found the manager to be most unhelpful and rather ignorant, didnt seem to want to go out of his way to be pleasant at all. We were given only 1 key which wasnt ideal because if we had been seperated 1 of us would not have been able to get in. Luckily this didnt actually happen. Our room was downstairs and considering we only paid 78 euros for 2 nights the room was huge with 3 single beds which we pushed together to make 1 huge bed. The windows were locked ( i think because it was at street level) but was rather worrying as if there had been a fire outside our room how would we have got out?? But on a more positive note the room was more than adequate for our needs, however there was an empty cake box under 1 of the beds so they obviously dont clean thouroughly, the bathroom was clean though and the bedding was changed daily so you couldnt ask for more there. The biggest problem that we found with this hotel was the breakfast it was awful in fact we took one look at it and did not even attempt to eat it, my husband requested a boiled egg as they had all gone and they refused to make anymore even though breakfast still had another 30 minutes to run!!! Then we were told that we could leave our bags at the hotel as our flight back was not til the evening but when we went back to get them no one had any idea where they were and to start with said that it was not their responsibility to look after them!? They were eventually found in someones hotel room????? So all in all it wasnt a disasterous stay but we would not choose to go back to this hotel again, but i guesss for what we paid you could not expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed very much”
Reviews.Author: ccc02e
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister, it felt very safe, and the staff was very helpful. The rooms were clean, very small but we donâ€™t really care about that. You could climb out our window onto a balcony which I enjoyed very much. We too were right next to the bathroom but I found it to be more convenient then a hassle. We had a TV with a DVD player and found this hotel to be one of the best throughout my travels through Europe. We donâ€™t expect much just a clean sheets and thatâ€™s what we got. Location was good, I wouldnâ€™t say great but for 2 females traveling alone we wouldnâ€™t come back too late at night just to be safe. I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “I visit amsterdam often and sphinx hotel is my place to come back!”
Reviews.Author: davidovich
Reviews.Content: This is my second time that i visited sphinx hotel and i definitly will come back. Clean rooms, basic but good breakfast, perfect location, friendly personal and really cheap prices! What do i want more??

Reviews.Title: “Caution”
Reviews.Author: r0b26
Reviews.Content: I was Shocked when i arrived at the Sphinx. The double room me and my mate were given was just 6ft wide, and about 18ft long. There was no room to swing a dead cat in there. The room was also next to the shared toilet, and didn't always smell the best. Some of the staff were friendly, others seemed to do as much as they could to avoid helping you- even down to the women who wouldn't give me my deposit back on checkout, because she never had any change! A further problem with the Sphinx was the breakfast! There was cheese, ham, salami, dry bread and boiled egs (which were nearly always black inside). One morning i asked if i could have my bread toasted- a seemingly proposterious request. It wasn't all bad though. The hotel is in a really good location, walking distence to almost all of the cities attractions. Although the room was small and smelt from time-to-time, if you not intending to be in your room much (which we weren't) then this hotel will do you just fine. Although personally i think it is very over priced for the standards it provides- next time i would stay in a hostel or the hotel Abba- cheaper and better quality and standards.

Reviews.Title: “Warning dont book here!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: timbo69
Reviews.Content: This place didnt honor our booking despite having my credit card number, we arrived at 12:15 just as my email said and they had given our room away. The place looked very basic and dated. the guy speaks very poor english and answered the door half shaven(shaving cream and all), he also had no advice on where else we could stay in amsterdam. we didnt find another hotel untill 12:00 the next day. DONT STAY HERE!!! there are better value places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Accommodation in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DearChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly fine. It wasn't the best low budget hotel I stayed in on my travels round Europe, but it wasn't the worst either. Staff were very friendly and welcoming (watch out for the 4% charge if you pay by credit card though). The room was nice and brightly decorated, and I didn't find it to be too small as per other reviews. The shower and toilet were okay, kind of old fashioned though. Just had a shower as quickly as I could! I would consider staying here again if I was returning to Amsterdam on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mozartik
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in sphinx hotel perfect location and clean rooms. The personal is friendly and the price not expensive what do you want more? I cant understand how peopel can expect more from a 2 star hotel.We like amsterdam and will come back to sphinx hotel definitly. Highly recomended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Philblunt
Reviews.Content: Basically, this hotel is cheap to stay in and I would recommend it for long weekends, but if you are staying longer, look elsewhere. The rooms are very well kept and clean, but they are very small. I read another review on this site of this hotel and it was said that you would have a hard job fitting anothing else in with a double bed, this is true. The rooms are small, be ready for that. There is a rather steep staircase but this is COMMON in Amsterdam and you should be travelling light anyway in my humble opinion, backed up with experience. The staff were reasonably polite, no issues there. Now, it WILL take you ten to fifteen mins walking to get up to the Dam Square area, so remember you'll be doing that at least twice if not six time a day, taxis soon add up. On the plus side, it is quiet and you can get some sleep when you do stay in. Book a taxi to Central Station for when you leave though, you dont want to be lugging your stuff that far in a rush to go home! To sum up, small rooms, very out of the way, cheap, clean. Phil Blunt, Oxon UK

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the Manager!!”
Reviews.Author: TonyHank
Reviews.Content: Beware of the Manager. We had booked a double room the night before we arrived and were told by the guy in reception that we had no booking upon our arrival. We then booked into another Hotel around the corner who were only too happy to have us. I returned to the Sphinx to double check that I was not going to be debited the $65 Euros only to be treated like something the manager had found on his shoe. I had returned in good faith and left with a very bitter taste about the lack of fair play and friendliness shown by the 'Manager' I would not advise anyone thinking of making a booking to arrive early at this place as the manager aparently lets his cleaning staff behind the check-in desk and lets them act as if they have an idea about how to take and deal with a booking. Give it a miss ... there's plenty better, cheaper and a whole world more friendly than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great”
Reviews.Author: travelingnatasha
Reviews.Content: I am a 20 year old female and Amsterdam was the first stop of me and my roommate in our Europe adventures. We arrived at the hotel around 7am and couldn't check in until noon but they let us leave our huge backpacks there. We left and walked around the area but since it was a Sunday, nothing was open. We came back to the hotel and they offered us coffee and tea so we stayed there until our check-in time. the manager is kind of crazy and silly but harmless, he was very nice and chatty. the stairs are definitely a struggle. they are very very narrow and steep, so it was difficult maneuvering our gigantic backpacks up the stairs. we're tough though so we managed. the shared toilets and shower were not a problem at all, and totally clean. the staff was very kind to us, we never found them rude or obnoxious as other reviews claim. our room was very small but bright and clean, we liked it a lot. it is a trek to anywhere of interest but we knew that already. the bus stops right by the hotel at the weterinchans circle so we just got to know the bus system well. i would reccomend this hotel to anyone traveling on a budget. i have pictures i can post once my laptop has internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: Sokol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights and boy did it add to my very negative experience in Amsterdam. Just so it would be easy to read I summed up all the negative and positive points of this hotel. Bad - 1. Deposite of 5 euros for the room key and the reception refuses to take your key when you leave for the day. A cheap way to make money if people lose the hotel key. Highly unprofessional. 2. 5% charge if you decide to pay for your stay by a credit card. 3. Extremely narrow, and I mean narrow staircases. Usually Dutch hotels have a pully for your luggage or staff to carry them. Sphinx does not. Be careful not to break your neck. P.S. No elevator. 4. We were never imformed that not every room has a shower and a toilet. So if you don't want to pay extra, you have to share a shower and a toilet with other occupants. 5. Rude staff. Very loud and obnoxoius.Talks in the backyard into the wee hours of the night. 6. Usually hotels give you leway during what time you can check in, this one didn't. Good points 1. Clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Brazil 26 Couple
Reviews.Content: Not a single restaurant / shop near the hotel. Rooms very small. I was not able to open my luggage inside it (room could barely fit a double bed). Of course, budget hotel. Recommend you search for a Hostal or Bed & Breakfast. Had to walk 5 mins and take 10 mins tram to reach Dam Square / city center. Closest attraction is Museumplein, more than 12 mins walking distance. Believe me, NOT WORTH EUR 55 / night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good located. All the sights are within walking distance!! The rooms are nicely decorated and really comfortable. Always clean too. The staff was exceptionally helpful. Always caring!! All in all: We are defenitively coming back to Sphinx Hotel Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “If you look for a beter hotel than you have to pay twice the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and 2 boy friends of me stayed 2 nights in sphinx hotel amsterdam.It is a cousy litle hotel which represent the typical architecture of amsterdam.From the time we cheked in we had a very positive feeling about the friendly stuff of this sympathiek hotel.It was not chekinn time but we leaved our bagage in the hotel and we walked in downtown of beatifull amsterdam.The location is far beyond perfect!!!You dont need to take a tram or bus or taxi because everything is surounded near around the hotel.When we came two hours later to chek in and moved our (heavy) bagage to our room.We where surprised by a big clean and comfortable looking room.I think there are a lot more hotels whit more luxury and comfort out there but definitly not for the prices this hotel is charging you.Whitout hesitatiion highly recomended! Jacky

Reviews.Title: “We had the feeling that this was the right Hotel for the right price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed whit my wife 4 nights in hotel sphinx amsterdam. We made reservation for double deluxe room when we came to the hotel the sympahtiek guy at the reception told us because there was a overbooking we where upgraded to a "sphinx suite" instead of a double deluxe room and ofcourse because it was the mistake of the hotel we get the sphinxsuite for the same price.We didnt pay more.That was pleasant surprise to start whit. When we came in our suite the room looked big, nice, clean and the smal was that typical pleasent smal of a clean space. The guy from the breakfast hall was nice helpfull and funny:) The location coud not be beter you can walk in 5 or 10 minutes to all museas, redlights, dam square... We where very hapy and can recomend whithout hasitation to everybody who is searching for a clean, small, good located hotel and dont want to pay 50% of the vacation budget to hotel only. Highly recomended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Linda33glasgow
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay for the price but a bit of advice if you book the sphinx suite be warned it is not in the hotel. The apartment was nearer to the centre but can be a bit noisy at night if the flatmate upstairs didn't play music all night. After you fix out some of the problems in the flat it is fine!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is perfect for young people traveling on a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned about staying at the Sphinx after reading some of the reviews, but it was cheap. When my friend and I arrived we had no idea what to expect and when the man at reception checked us into room 13 I nearly lost it. We climbed the very steep staircase to the 3rd floor (4 in all) and opened our door, which took a little time becuase the magnetic strip keys are old, and to our relief the room was very clean, tiddy, and smelled great. We stayed for 5 nights and never had a problem. I'm not trying to say that this hotel is like staying at the Ritz or Hilton, but you definetly get your money's worth. A few things to take into concideration: the stairs(not a good idea for the elderly), the locks(be patient,they will work), breakfast(eat out), the shower(down the hall, bring your flip flops), the rooms(small yet a perfect base of operations for planning all of your misadventures in the greatest city in the world), the beds(clean and useful). All in all, if you want to hang out in your hotel room all day and think of stuff to complain about you shouldn't stay here(c'mon, it's a 2 star hotel). If you are looking for a cheap/safe place to lay your spinning head at night, you will have no problems staying here. HAVE FUN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location very good!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had fun in amsterdam and we liked the hotel too.Clean rooms friendly staff perfect location good prices... Exactly whats we are looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Hell Hole”
Reviews.Author: Danielle238
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms were disgusting & unclean. I viewed rooms on every floor of this hotel & they were all vile, the bathrooms were like something you would expect to find at a festival having been used by 100,000 people. The staff was equally as bad, often they were rude, unhelpful & at times aggressive (mainly the manager). My experience of this hotel was that the manager just wants your money no matter what, we paid on arrival for the room in cash however the manager felt it necessary to debit money from my credit card even though we had paid in full in cash! The battle to return this money is still on going. Itâ€™s such a shame as Amsterdam is fantastic city & has so much to offer but is being let down by the Sphinx Hotel AKA Hell Hole!

HotelInfo.Name: Sphinx Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Weteringschans 82, Amsterdam 1017 XR, The Netherlands
